body: I think we could work this into the formatter? Look for multiple lines and autofence?
Yep, that was what I was suggesting we do :).  That's why I opened the issue here.

issue.title: Automatically wrap multiline deprecation messages
issue.body:
Fixes #1336

Once merged should audit usages of `warn_deprecate` to remove existing fences in messages:
- [ ] rspec
- [ ] rspec-core
- [ ] rspec-mocks
- [ ] rspec-expectations
- [ ] rspec-support

body: Your [example deprecation](https://github.com/rspec/rspec-core/blob/5c21c7676f32a4f4d74272a9cacbaa413748a2ec/lib/rspec/core/example_group.rb#L452-L456) is using `Kernel#warn` and not RSpec's deprecation api…

I feel a little bit mixed about this. Deprecation warnings already take up a lot of screen space, and this would make multiline warnings more consistent… but also consistently longer.

Maybe the warning messages that bleed into other messages should be changed to follow a more-readable format that doesn't have the extra lines around them?

> Your example deprecation is using Kernel#warn and not RSpec's deprecation api…

It should be updated then.  Woops!

> Maybe the warning messages that bleed into other messages should be changed to follow a more-readable format that doesn't have the extra lines around them?

I'm open to other ideas, but I'm not sure how to do that for a warning like this:

https://github.com/rspec/rspec-core/blob/e5d95136bb6dfb7d9b40a8300be783c16f1a770a/lib/rspec/core/example_group.rb#L532-L550
I don't really have a better idea :frowning: That's a really good warning message.
What about adding a flag to turn it off or on? Like how we're grouping on type and optionally suppressing caller?

> What about adding a flag to turn it off or on? Like how we're grouping on type and optionally suppressing caller?

Would this be a config option for end users?  That seems like overkill to me.
No for us, so that some messages can be fenced when it looks more readable, or left to be compressed otherwise?
A per message option sounds fine.
